commit_message:
test: assert behavior of proxy_logging metrics

Change-Id: I651ddd40e9115a56727096d4a3aa84589146308f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/32/915032/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import timefrom swift.common.swob import Request, Response, HTTPServiceUnavailablefrom test.unit.common.middleware.helpers import FakeAppThatExcepts, FakeSwift def test_object_error(self): swift = FakeSwift() self.logger = debug_logger() app = proxy_logging.ProxyLoggingMiddleware(swift, {}, logger=self.logger) swift.register('GET', '/v1/a/c/o', HTTPServiceUnavailable, {}, None) req = Request.blank('/v1/a/c/o') start = time.time() ttfb = start + 0.2 end = ttfb + 0.5 with mock.patch("swift.common.middleware.proxy_logging.time.time", side_effect=[start, ttfb, end]): resp = req.get_response(app) self.assertEqual(503, resp.status_int) # we have to consume the resp body to trigger logging self.assertIn(b'Service Unavailable', resp.body) log_parts = self._log_parts(app) self.assertEqual(log_parts[3], 'GET') self.assertEqual(log_parts[4], '/v1/a/c/o') self.assertEqual(log_parts[5], 'HTTP/1.0') self.assertEqual(log_parts[6], '503') # we can also expect error metrics self.assertTiming('object.GET.503.timing', app, exp_timing=700.0) def test_basic_error(self): swift = FakeSwift() self.logger = debug_logger() app = proxy_logging.ProxyLoggingMiddleware(swift, {}, logger=self.logger) swift.register('GET', '/path', HTTPServiceUnavailable, {}, None) req = Request.blank('/path') start = time.time() ttfb = start + 0.2 end = ttfb + 0.5 with mock.patch("swift.common.middleware.proxy_logging.time.time", side_effect=[start, ttfb, end]): resp = req.get_response(app) self.assertEqual(503, resp.status_int) # we have to consume the resp body to trigger logging self.assertIn(b'Service Unavailable', resp.body) log_parts = self._log_parts(app) self.assertEqual(log_parts[3], 'GET') self.assertEqual(log_parts[4], '/path') self.assertEqual(log_parts[5], 'HTTP/1.0') self.assertEqual(log_parts[6], '503') # but we don't get metrics!? self.assertFalse(app.access_logger.statsd_client.calls) def test_middleware_exception(self): self.logger = debug_logger() app = proxy_logging.ProxyLoggingMiddleware( FakeAppThatExcepts(), {}, logger=self.logger) req = Request.blank('/path') start = time.time() ttfb = start + 0.2 with mock.patch("swift.common.middleware.proxy_logging.time.time", side_effect=[start, ttfb]), \ self.assertRaises(Exception): req.get_response(app) log_parts = self._log_parts(app) self.assertEqual(log_parts[3], 'GET') self.assertEqual(log_parts[4], '/path') self.assertEqual(log_parts[5], 'HTTP/1.0') self.assertEqual(log_parts[6], '500') # but we don't get metrics!? self.assertFalse(app.access_logger.statsd_client.calls) def test_middleware_error(self): class ErrorFakeApp(object): def __call__(self, env, start_response): env['swift.source'] = 'FA' resp = HTTPServiceUnavailable() return resp(env, start_response) self.logger = debug_logger() app = proxy_logging.ProxyLoggingMiddleware(ErrorFakeApp(), {}, logger=self.logger) req = Request.blank('/path') start = time.time() ttfb = start + 0.2 end = ttfb + 0.5 with mock.patch("swift.common.middleware.proxy_logging.time.time", side_effect=[start, ttfb, end]): resp = req.get_response(app) self.assertEqual(503, resp.status_int) # we have to consume the resp body to trigger logging self.assertIn(b'Service Unavailable', resp.body) log_parts = self._log_parts(app) self.assertEqual(log_parts[3], 'GET') self.assertEqual(log_parts[4], '/path') self.assertEqual(log_parts[5], 'HTTP/1.0') self.assertEqual(log_parts[6], '503') # we can also expect error metrics self.assertTiming('FA.GET.503.timing', app, exp_timing=700.0)
deleted_lines: from swift.common.swob import Request, Responsefrom test.unit.common.middleware.helpers import FakeAppThatExcepts

commit_message:
Re-add django-pymemcache

This is partial revert of 07d44b297bfe3d30685327890729d82d504850bb .

django-pymemcache is actually used by Horizon to use memcached as
cache backend.

Change-Id: I0647c294aa53c18eb8dfe29c84502c1c46dabd7a

commit_message:
Deprecate watch_log_file

This feature has been broken for some time without any actual update
to fix it. Also the pyinotify package used hasn't been updated for 9
years and looks badly unmaintained.

Related-Bug: #1740111
Related-Bug: #2059855
Change-Id: If776fee0072d95737e1c19ad673a3c881a89de06
(cherry picked from commit 31603ac6dacd0b47ec9f02d99bfdd0a7b683119c)

commit_message:
Switch to stable/2024.1

Since 2024.1 release was created we can start testing the release
content. Note that Ubuntu continues using 2023.2 until 2024.1 is
released in UCA.

Change-Id: Ia366cf2886d3b68fad190cb47e914949747b9cfe

commit_message:
Remove SQLAlchemy tips jobs

The most recent SQLAlchemy and Alembic versions are now in
upper-constraints. As a result, this job has served its purpose and can
be removed. For more information, see [1].

[1] https://lists.openstack.org/archives/list/openstack-discuss@lists.openstack.org/thread/RBHXHTO3GUOOXVSZXD4C2O3TKDOH2QSC/

Change-Id: I652d8b435f400698b1a0950a7f81c8bc1813d388
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/879743
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/65/915565/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Temporary job until SQLAlchemy 2.0 is no longer blocked by upper-requirements - job: name: barbican-tox-py310-with-sqlalchemy-2x parent: openstack-tox-py310 description: | Run unit tests with main branch of SQLAlchemy, alembic and oslo.db. Takes advantage of the base tox job's install-siblings feature. # The job only tests the latest and shouldn't be run on the stable branches branches: regex: ^stable negate: true required-projects: - name: github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy override-checkout: main - name: github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic override-checkout: main - name: openstack/oslo.db - barbican-tox-py310-with-sqlalchemy-2x - barbican-tox-py310-with-sqlalchemy-2x

commit_message:
[WIP]: Add "discoverability service" spec

Co-Author: Felix Kronlage-Dammers <fkr@hazardous.org>

Change-Id: I656f96090b408ab7369830dc11fb9022fc4a6513
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/publiccloud-sig refs/changes/87/909387/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================= Discoverability service ======================= This spec proposes to introduce new "discoverability" service oriented mainly on an end users of the cloud helping them to find resource types they need to use in order to provision the workload (flavor, image, volume type). Problem description =================== Very often cloud users report issues with regards to discoverability of the cloud features where they need to try multiple options before a working method can be found. This is related to various aspects of different resources like images, flavors, networks, volume types. A user typically expects that it should be sufficient to describe the workload that needs to be provisioned and matching resources should be automatically identified (i.e. a flavors with 8 vCPUs and 16Gb RAM without GPU support). This is currently not the case with OpenStack and due to great diversity in OpenStack deployment and configuration styles is not really trivial. A multiple cloud requests are necessary only to identify "candidate" resources which are still not guaranteed to work. Another aspec of this situation is that it affects interoperability between clouds since users tend to hardcode values they know are working in a certain cloud, but those are most likely not even existing in another cloud. The effect of the issue is that Sovereign Cloud Stack proposed to agree on a `naming convention <https://docs.scs.community/standards/scs-0100-v3-flavor-naming/>`_ between clouds for such resources. It quickly become so complex, that it is impossible to explain to end user meaning of such cryptic names. In addition to that multiple cloud operators expressed that they are neither capable nor ready to start renaming existing flavors and images. A yet another aspect of the user requests is a need to identify resource (mostly related to the flavor) that they would be able to provision in the cloud (flavor availability in certain region/AZ). A sensible amount of operators and end users report issues with deploying their workload which are failing because due to flavors being "sold out" in certain AZ and no possibility for the end user to figure this out without calling cloud support. At the moment majority of the listed use cases can be addressed partially relying on the flavor extra_spec, volume extra_spec and image properties. However the data there is not standardized sufficiently. A concept of metadefs provided by Image service can be used to provide information about those properties (to discover which property is of which type and its description). Use cases --------- A typical user requests have been identified and listed here. - Provision VM with certain set of required resources (# CPU, memory, disk dize) - Provision a workload using localy attached disks - Provision a workload with hard defined resources (i.e. exactly 8 vCPU) - Provision a workload with soft defined resources (i.e. around 8 vCPU or at minimum/maximum 8 vCPU ) - Provision a workload on a flavor with specifically ECC memory - Provision a workload on a flavor with DGPU - Provision a workload on a flavor with Nvidia DGPU and 80GB GPU RAM - Provision a workload on a flavor with GPU with support of certain feature (i.e. VDI, compute, ...) - Provision a workload on ARM CPU - Provision a workload on Intel Xth generation CPU - Provision a workload with support of nested or hardware virtualization - Provision a workload on a dedicated CPU/core - Provision a workload on a CPU with "low" oversubscription - Provision a workload requiring Infiniband network connectivity - Provision a load on volume types supporting data encryption - Provision a workload on volume type that supports replication (e.g. ceph) - Provision a workload with flavor and volume type specification that is available in certain region/az - Ability to migrate between clouds keeping only infrastructure specification in the deployment automation tooling Proposed change =============== Alternatives ------------ REST API impact --------------- Security impact --------------- End user impact --------------- Implementation ============== Testing ======= Documentation impact ====================

commit_message:
Add support for elasticsearch datastreams

Currently, cloudkitty only uses Elasticsearch leagacy index, but not
datastreams. Datastreams are much nicer, because they handle automation
for rotating data to cold storage (if the elastic cluster has multiple
types of storage, like hot / warm / cold).

This patch adds a configuration option to use datastreams.

Change-Id: Iac717c948665effda82a2a87329647c74e3f0667
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/92/915992/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
add pyproject.toml to support pip 23.1

pip 23.1 removed the "setup.py install" fallback for projects
that do not have pyproject.toml and now uses a pyproject.toml
which is vendored in pip.
To address that, this change adds the minimal pyproject.toml
to enable pbr to be properly used to build editable wheels.

This is required to support installing devstack on
centos stream 9 and related distros with GLOBAL_VENV=True
Without this change the wsgi scripts are not generated in
editable mode. i.e. pip install -e /opt/stack/keystone

See https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/news/#v23-1
and https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/8368 for more
details on the removal of the fallback support.

setuptools v64.0.0 is used to support editable installs
via its PEP-660 implmentation
https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/pull/3488

Change-Id: Iba16dde8ddb5b0da2bb191c38ab6a72c0b2db007
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osc-placement refs/changes/55/899955/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add parameters to cinder backend configuration

Add configuration parameters cinder_store_user_name,
cinder_store_password, cinder_store_project_name and
cinder_store_auth_address to cinder volume type backend configuration.
This avoids a glance_store bug that prevents glance-api from starting.

Closes-Bug: #2052726
Change-Id: I4b6ca32ed426f77a326711c2457046dbda594e77

commit_message:
Add script to automatically create charm tracks

The tracks are looked up from zuul.d/zuul.yaml. Changes these tracks
before running the script.

This script will check if the track exists before creating it.

Change-Id: If3fd2910319970f63608350ea43c3c2ab6c77ffc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sunbeam-charms refs/changes/99/916399/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # This script look inside publish_channels for all tracks that should exits. # If the track does not exist, it creates it. if ! command -v charmcraft &> /dev/null then echo "charmcraft could not be found" echo "Install it with: snap install charmcraft --classic" exit 1 fi if ! command -v yq &> /dev/null then echo "yq could not be found" echo "Install it with: snap install yq" exit 1 fi if ! command -v jq &> /dev/null then echo "jq could not be found" echo "Install it with: snap install jq" exit 1 fi if ! command -v curl &> /dev/null then echo "curl could not be found" echo "Install it with: apt install curl" exit 1 fi opt_charm="" publish_channel=$(yq -r '.[0].project.vars.publish_channels | to_entries | .[] | (.key + " " + .value)' zuul.d/zuul.yaml) while IFS=' ' read -r charm _; do opt_charm="$opt_charm --charm=$charm" done < <(echo "$publish_channel") charmcraft login --export=sunbeam-charms.auth \ $opt_charm \ --permission=package-view-metadata \ --permission=package-manage-metadata \ --ttl=3600 CHARMHUB_MACAROON_HEADER="Authorization: Macaroon $(cat sunbeam-charms.auth | base64 -d | jq -r .v)" while IFS=' ' read -r charm channel; do track=$(echo "$channel" | cut -d'/' -f1) url=https://api.charmhub.io/v1/charm/$charm metadata=$(curl -s "$url" -H'Content-type: application/json' -H "$CHARMHUB_MACAROON_HEADER") tracks=$(echo "$metadata" | jq -r '.metadata.tracks[].name') if [[ $tracks =~ $track ]]; then echo "Track $track already exists for charm $charm" else echo "Creating track $track for charm $charm" curl -s "$url/tracks" -X POST -H'Content-type: application/json' -H "$CHARMHUB_MACAROON_HEADER" -d '[{"name": "'"$track"'"}]' fi done < <(echo "$publish_channel") # Clean the created files rm sunbeam-charms.*

commit_message:
add pyproject.toml to support pip 23.1

pip 23.1 removed the "setup.py install" fallback for projects
that do not have pyproject.toml and now uses a pyproject.toml
which is vendored in pip.
To address that, this change adds the minimal pyproject.toml
to enable pbr to be properly used to build editable wheels.

This is required to support installing devstack on
centos stream 9 and related distros with GLOBAL_VENV=True
Without this change the wsgi scripts are not generated in
editable mode. i.e. pip install -e /opt/stack/keystone

See https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/news/#v23-1
and https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/8368 for more
details on the removal of the fallback support.

setuptools v64.0.0 is used to support editable installs
via its PEP-660 implmentation
https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/pull/3488

Change-Id: I50be314d6d2578fa5b7f3a46fb72502d9f38d5e8

commit_message:
add pyproject.toml to support pip 23.1

pip 23.1 removed the "setup.py install" fallback for projects
that do not have pyproject.toml and now uses a pyproject.toml
which is vendored in pip.
To address that, this change adds the minimal pyproject.toml
to enable pbr to be properly used to build editable wheels.

This is required to support installing devstack on
centos stream 9 and related distros with GLOBAL_VENV=True
Without this change the wsgi scripts are not generated in
editable mode. i.e. pip install -e /opt/stack/keystone

See https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/news/#v23-1
and https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/8368 for more
details on the removal of the fallback support.

setuptools v64.0.0 is used to support editable installs
via its PEP-660 implmentation
https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/pull/3488

Change-Id: I04e254db3510f61b52b2ed753fb07e00150e288d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-04-20 01:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-resource-classes/commit/4f8ff470ad42a48460ed49bed1f806b3e3ffcc9b', 'message': "Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I50b984c733729ec8e218aeb5e36efbdde46e556e
"}]
commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I50b984c733729ec8e218aeb5e36efbdde46e556e

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-10-31 21:25:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e93334f0266e9bd2fd4fa5798de3f5d35abbe37c', 'message': 'add pyproject.toml to support pip 23.1

pip 23.1 removed the "setup.py install" fallback for projects
that do not have pyproject.toml and now uses a pyproject.toml
which is vendored in pip.
To address that, this change adds the minimal pyproject.toml
to enable pbr to be properly used to build editable wheels.

This is required to support installing devstack on
centos stream 9 and related distros with GLOBAL_VENV=True
Without this change the wsgi scripts are not generated in
editable mode. i.e. pip install -e /opt/stack/keystone

See https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/news/#v23-1
and https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/8368 for more
details on the removal of the fallback support.

commit_message:
add pyproject.toml to support pip 23.1

pip 23.1 removed the "setup.py install" fallback for projects
that do not have pyproject.toml and now uses a pyproject.toml
which is vendored in pip.
To address that, this change adds the minimal pyproject.toml
to enable pbr to be properly used to build editable wheels.

This is required to support installing devstack on
centos stream 9 and related distros with GLOBAL_VENV=True
Without this change the wsgi scripts are not generated in
editable mode. i.e. pip install -e /opt/stack/keystone

See https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/news/#v23-1
and https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/8368 for more
details on the removal of the fallback support.

setuptools v64.0.0 is used to support editable installs
via its PEP-660 implmentation
https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/pull/3488

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/902758
Change-Id: I3255edb67fd7fe7a25b5871ec071c4b4c9d98ac2

commit_message:
Update python classifier in setup.cfg

As per the current release tested runtime, we test
till python 3.11 so updating the same in python

commit_message:
Replace remaining usage of [DEFAULT] sql_connection

The previous attempt[1] was incomplete and these was still one usage
left. The deprecated alias was removed from oslo.db[2] and no longer
works.

[1] b6b9f043ffe664c643456912148648ecc0d6c9b4

commit_message:
Update for 2024.1

Refresh 2023.2 -> 2024.1 which will impact all charms, so we
should not need to pre-seed the edge channel before this works.

Refresh 23.09 -> 24.03 for OVN charms.

Option sql_connection is removed form 2024.1 release [1]
Use below snippet for magnum-k8s conf template
[database]
connection = <>

Update horizon local_settings.py.j2 template

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.db/en_GB/2024.1.html

Mark tempest test as non-voting as its currently unstable.

Change-Id: I4e277a4c5e438e2f2112a167b0f3050c1526cd0a

commit_message:
Make a release of os-(apply|collect|refresh)-config

To include all the changes merged during Caracal cycle.

Support for python versions has been removed so we need to bump major
version.

Change-Id: I5e1f6d98e748ae87d4c165e379f96adff5427902

commit_message:
Add states.SERVICING and SERVICEWAIT to _FASTTRACK_HEARTBEAT_ALLOWED

Currently, service steps may fail to start in scenarios dependent on IPA
fasttrack. This change attempts to resolve this by incorporating
servicing states in the fast track allowed states whitelist while also
making _FASTTRACK_HEARTBEAT_ALLOWED a superset of _HEARTBEAT_ALLOWED
instead of duplicating values in the two constants.

Change-Id: I47984469c1432e7fc7b4f1494b9f6c551c34672f
(cherry picked from commit 619e1ac80ccc6f20e32a2a80d31637dd45d6d45b)

commit_message:
Add states.SERVICING and SERVICEWAIT to _FASTTRACK_HEARTBEAT_ALLOWED

Currently, service steps may fail to start in scenarios dependent on IPA
fasttrack. This change attempts to resolve this by incorporating
servicing states in the fast track allowed states whitelist while also
making _FASTTRACK_HEARTBEAT_ALLOWED a superset of _HEARTBEAT_ALLOWED
instead of duplicating values in the two constants.

Change-Id: I47984469c1432e7fc7b4f1494b9f6c551c34672f
(cherry picked from commit 619e1ac80ccc6f20e32a2a80d31637dd45d6d45b)

" "This bug will appear if the backup file is created while MariaDB is " "processing too many update requests. See the following for more details: " "`Story 2010999 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2010999>` __" "Fix a bug where docker daemon occasionally returns error: `failed to set " "IPv6 gateway while updating gateway: file exists: unknown` when " "network_isolation is enabled." msgstr "" "Fix a bug where docker daemon occasionally returns error: `failed to set " "IPv6 gateway while updating gateway: file exists: unknown` when " "network_isolation is enabled." msgid "" "Fix a bug where swift client in the trove guest instance failed to verify " "certification against the self-signed certificate authority. `Story 2010674 " "<https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2010674>`__" msgstr "" "Fix a bug where Swift client in the trove guest instance failed to verify " "certification against the self-signed certificate authority. `Story 2010674 " "<https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2010674>`__" msgid "" "Fix a bug where the mysql container is unable to recover after a reboot of " "the Nova instance. `Story 2010599 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/" "story/2010599>`__" msgstr "" "Fix a bug where the MySQL container is unable to recover after a reboot of " "the Nova instance. `Story 2010599 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/" "story/2010599>`__" msgid "" "Fix a bug where the postgresql container is unable to recover after a reboot " "of the Nova instance. `Story 2010599 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/" "story/2010599>`__" msgstr "" "Fix a bug where the PostgreSQL container is unable to recover after a reboot " "of the Nova instance. `Story 2010599 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/" "story/2010599>`__" msgid """Fix potential PostgreSQL database creation failures from the instance create " "API" msgstr "" "Fix potential PostgreSQL database creation failures from the instance create " "API" msgid """Fix the way to check instance status. subject: Deprecate Masakari
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-11-16 17:45:51.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/reference/compute/masakari-guide.rst', 'README.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/deprecate-masakari-15bf8f90f1d1f509.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/9675347fecd2907e7f60e84e405abcedf426b229', 'message': 'Deprecate Masakari

Since the CI is failing and there are no contributors working on fixing
this, we are deprecating the service.

Also mention other deprecations in the README.

Change-Id: Ifff11645f6b4682810c042a0421d1eb569ab0ede
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate Masakari

Since the CI is failing and there are no contributors working on fixing
this, we are deprecating the service.

Also mention other deprecations in the README.

Change-Id: Ifff11645f6b4682810c042a0421d1eb569ab0ede
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/93/901193/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - | Deprecates support for deploying Masakari. Support for deploying Masakari will be removed from Kolla Ansible in the Caracal Release.

subject: stable-only: Remove redundant branch override
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-04-18 16:14:27.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/base.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/commit/038c1a84bbe5386043bdc3d0a5f01aeca0abd431', 'message': 'stable-only: Remove redundant branch override

The same stable branch will be automatically checked out by zuul unless
the branch is overridden.

Change-Id: I7829abd19a6c6f7c9f528ad0ddad511aa888d2d6
'}]
commit_message:
stable-only: Remove redundant branch override

The same stable branch will be automatically checked out by zuul unless
the branch is overridden.

Change-Id: I7829abd19a6c6f7c9f528ad0ddad511aa888d2d6

subject: Update python classifier in setup.cfg
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-01-11 23:37:27.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config/commit/4090e0f069c1340d9700a3fdece30d858707cd88', 'message': 'Update python classifier in setup.cfg

As per the current release tested runtime, we test
python version from 3.8 to 3.11 so updating the
same in python classifier in setup.cfg

Change-Id: Ib306efd5d2f6d177aba6bf6307f4132252ac2b14
'}]
commit_message:
Update python classifier in setup.cfg

As per the current release tested runtime, we test
python version from 3.8 to 3.11 so updating the
same in python classifier in setup.cfg

Change-Id: Ib306efd5d2f6d177aba6bf6307f4132252ac2b14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/73/905373/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: python_requires = >=3.8 Programming Language :: Python :: 3.8 Programming Language :: Python :: 3.9 Programming Language :: Python :: 3.10 Programming Language :: Python :: 3.11
deleted_lines: python_requires = >=3.5 Programming Language :: Python :: 3.5 Programming Language :: Python :: 3.6 Programming Language :: Python :: 3.7

subject: Support using non unix timestamp serial.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-03-29 09:19:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/44641cac1733b3b77ebdad6ad7d0922ede161e9c', 'message': 'Support using non unix timestamp serial.

RFC1982 allows to have different formats including:
    - Simple increment of any number
    - Unixtime
    - Date with counter format YYYYMMDDNN
This changes allow to use any supported serial format and fix some pep8 errors
for related code.
Serial will be increased to current timestamp if current timestamp between zone created_at and current timestamp
Serial will be increased to +1 if current timestamp less or bigger then zone created_at or bigger then current timestamp

Closes-bug: #2053022
Change-Id: I52f7834c423ed3fdbfe2441780f917db658a2bcb
Signed-off-by: Mikhail Samoylov <mikhailsamoiloff@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I52f7834c423ed3fdbfe2441780f917db658a2bcb
Signed-off-by: Mikhail Samoylov <mikhailsamoiloff@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Support using non unix timestamp serial.

RFC1982 allows to have different formats including:
    - Simple increment of any number
    - Unixtime
    - Date with counter format YYYYMMDDNN
This changes allow to use any supported serial format and fix some pep8 errors for related code.
Serial will be increased to current timestamp if current timestamp between zone created_at and current timestamp
Serial will be increased to +1 if current timestamp less or bigger then zone created_at or bigger then current timestamp

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin/+/915069
Closes-bug: #2053022
Change-Id: I52f7834c423ed3fdbfe2441780f917db658a2bcb
Signed-off-by: Mikhail Samoylov <mikhailsamoiloff@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix Users/Groups tab list when a domain context is set

The list of users assigned to a project becomes invisible when a domain context
is set in Horizon. If a domain context is set, the user list call should
provide a list of users within the specified domain context, rather than users
within the user's own domain.

Groups tab of project also has the same problem.

Change-Id: Ia778317acc41fe589765e6cd04c7fe8cad2360ab
Closes-Bug: #2054799
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/21/910321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack_dashboard.utils import identity domain_id = identity.get_domain_id_for_operation(self.request) users = api.keystone.user_list(self.request, domain=domain_id)

Add subchart cli argument

This is necessary for the umbrella chart
which contains overrides for multiple subcharts.

", subchart) } fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Features: %s
", strings.Join(features, " ")) overrideCandidates := generateOverrideCandidates(features) overrideArgs := getOverrideArgs(baseUrl, basePath, chart, subchart, overrideCandidates, download) fmt.Fprintf(os.Stderr, "Resulting override args: %s

exist in the path (default: false)") rootCmd.Flags().StringVarP(&baseUrl, "url", "u", DefaultBaseUrl, "Base url to download overrides") rootCmd.Flags().StringVarP(&basePath, "path", "p", cwd, "Path to the overrides") rootCmd.Flags().StringVarP(&subchart, "subchart", "s", "", "Subchart to get the overrides for") rootCmd.Flags().StringVarP(&chart, "chart", "c", "", "Chart to get the overrides for") fmt.Sprintf("%s/%s/values_overrides/%s/%s", baseUrl, chart, subchart, overrideName) } return fmt.Sprintf("%s/%s/values_overrides/%s", baseUrl, chart, overrideName) } func downloadOverride(baseUrl, commit_message:
Add keystone audit middleware API logging

This commit adds Keystone audit middleware API logging to the Cinder
charm in versions Yoga and newer to allow users to configure their
environment for CADF compliance. This feature can be enabled/disabled
and is set to 'disabled' by default to avoid bloat in log files.
The logging output is configured to /var/log/apache2/cinder_error.log.
This commit builds on previous discussions:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/808.

Related-Pr: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/893
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1200
Closes-Bug: 1856555
Change-Id: I0066e0f91e97621a4efa4d000ba8eb40ccb17cda

commit_message:
Fix str to str comparison in live migration test

The str to str comparison in the
test_server_connectivity_live_migration_compute uses a "<"
operation that does not work as intended. Let's fix that by using
the tempest module created for comparing string microversions.

Change-Id: Id6d18c93e8637d797404a62a23d3fcc61208fd4c

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/46/916346/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 2024.2-Release Timeline ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ #. Update oslo.policy ``enforce_new_defaults=True`` At this stage, all the services are supposed to complete `Phase 1`_ and enabled the ``enforce_new_defaults`` flag at service level. Now we can update the default value of config option ``enforce_new_defaults`` in oslo.policy to True (means enable it by default at oslo policy level and service can disable it if they still need more time). This will allow each service to remove code to override the ``enforce_new_defaults=True`` and use the upstream default from oslo.policy. If any service still needs to keep the default as False then they can do it by overriding the default. #. Update oslo.policy ``enforce_scope=True`` At this stage, all the services are supposed to complete `Phase 1`_ and enabled the ``enforce_scope`` flag at service level. Now we can update the default value of config option ``enforce_scope`` in oslo.policy to True. This will allow each service to remove code to override the ``enforce_scope=True`` and use the upstream default from oslo.policy. If any service still needs to keep the default as False then they can do it by overriding the default. 2025.2-Release Timeline ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ #. Remove the oslo.policy ``enforce_scope`` config flag The config option ``enforce_scope`` was added temporarily to migrate to the new RBAC. This is enabled by default in the 2024.2 release (and also in 2025.2 SLURP release) means all deployments get the scope enabled by default. Now we can remove this config flag and have scope checks enabled by default.

commit_message:
Use bootloader element instead of grub2

bootloader is recommended since it aims to build a valid grub config
instead of just installing the packages.

Also, mark legacy job as non-voting for the time being

The legacy job is broken because of a know issue with tinycore related
to the glibc library.  Moving it to non-voting for the time being while
we evaluate if it's worth trying to fix it or jsut remove it.

Also, install diskimage-builder from the checked-out repo, so that
depends on works as expected.

Change-Id: I642a1579e95dfff2188206313ea6d315b0533a5f

commit_message:
Remove redundant priority override code from service steps

Currently, service steps are only supported as a user-requested action.
This change removes references to overriding priorities for service
steps as these overrides will have no effect and may cause confusion.

Change-Id: I35a8b59b17fdff3161df835903acec529e732c4f

commit_message:
Correct logging call in _heartbeat_service_wait method

Currently, _heartbeat_service_wait() is causing an error due to a
missing parameter in the call. This change resolves this issue by
removing the reference to the missing parameter.

Change-Id: I03faa67953daf282ae1b576a2a949c94a2efa973

commit_message:
Appoint Jens Harbott as Skyline PTL

Since there has been no candidate for the Skyline PTL position in the
2024.2 election, I hereby volunteer to take up this position and keep
the project alive.

commit_message:
Include COU in openstack upgrade page

Charmed-OpenStack-Upgrader (COU), as an automation tool developed
to encapsulate the official charm and payload upgrade processes,
should be mentioned in the charm-guide. This patch adds the
reference to it.

Co-Authored-By: Peter Matulis <peter.matulis@canonical.com>
Change-Id: I03666ad1f882c71330188fd34cb3a5aa4db48b98
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/03/905503/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: `Charmed OpenStack Upgrader`_ (**COU**) is a tool developed to standardize and automate upgrade procedures and is now available as a tech preview. COU encapsulates the processes described in this document, which remain the primary method to upgrade a cloud and should be referred to in case of unexpected behavior. See `COU documentation`_ for more information. .. _Charmed OpenStack Upgrader: https://snapcraft.io/charmed-openstack-upgrader .. _COU Documentation: https://canonical-charmed-openstack-upgrader.readthedocs-hosted.com/

commit_message:
Implement allowed values for BootSourceOverrideEnabled

Some Redfish implementations (i.e. Lenovo) seem to only support a subset of the BootSourceOverrideEnabled options.
This change will expose the allowed values via get_allowed_system_boot_enabled_values.

Story: #2010161
Task: #45819
Change-Id: I8ba981221339d91c4985d2e761e47a99887159ec

subject: Test resize with mem_page_size in flavor
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-01-14 18:38:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin/commit/c30e5ed4287a5972524f952e9979ca65a19a54d9', 'message': 'Test resize with mem_page_size in flavor

These tests are meant to address issue [1]. It adds three new testcases:

 * test_hugepage_resize_keyword_large_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_pagesize_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_size_to_size

All three tests follow the same basic procedure, spawn a guest with a
flavor using hw:mem_page_size:<size_a>, resize the guest to a flavor
with a different size hw:mem_page_size:<size_b>, and then resize the
guest back to the original flavor. Throughout the tests XML checks are
conducted to ensure the page size is accurate for the present flavor.

Instead of trying to dynamically determine the hugepage sizes configured
on the computes, a new config parameter was added to define what
hugepage sizes are available on the host. To avoid dynamic ram
calculation sizes for the guest based on available hugepages, a guest
ram parameter was also added so users may define the size to use when
spawning guests.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1831269

Change-Id: I5282df3b20c24a909f3b7bb97214206bc07e5b91
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-01-21 15:38:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin/commit/515008f83c41819bd14cbc819c20bb63bef22b3a', 'message': 'Test resize with mem_page_size in flavor

 * test_hugepage_resize_keyword_large_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_pagesize_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_size_to_size

All three tests follow the same basic procedure, spawn a guest with a
flavor using hw:mem_page_size:<size_a>, resize the guest to a flavor
with a different size hw:mem_page_size:<size_b>, and then resize the

'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2022-04-23 14:02:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin/commit/961cf58e3c87f8a2760d6da02114cd21c9e467ed', 'message': 'Test resize with mem_page_size in flavor

These tests are meant to address issue [1]. It adds three new testcases:

 * test_hugepage_resize_keyword_large_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_pagesize_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_size_to_size

All three tests follow the same basic procedure, spawn a guest with a
flavor using hw:mem_page_size:<size_a>, resize the guest to a flavor
with a different size hw:mem_page_size:<size_b>, and then resize the
guest back to the original flavor. Throughout the tests XML checks are
conducted to ensure the page size is accurate for the present flavor.

Instead of trying to dynamically determine the hugepage sizes configured
on the computes, a new config parameter was added to define what
hugepage sizes are available on the host. To avoid dynamic ram
calculation sizes for the guest based on available hugepages, a guest
ram parameter was also added so users may define the size to use when
spawning guests.

We also need a new job that has multiple hugepage sizes configured. We
cannot use our existing whitebox-devstack-multinode job because that
one runs tests that dynamically turn on file backed memory, which is
incompatible with hugepages. This commit adds tasks into job setup
that allows for the setup of hugepages.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1831269

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/825011

Change-Id: I5282df3b20c24a909f3b7bb97214206bc07e5b91

'}, {'number': 20, 'created': '2022-04-24 19:50:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin/commit/89e6e82448b294962a020a584ce59127b34489e8', 'message': 'Test resize with mem_page_size in flavor

These tests are meant to address issue [1]. It adds three new testcases:

 * test_hugepage_resize_keyword_large_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_pagesize_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_size_to_size

All three tests follow the same basic procedure, spawn a guest with a
flavor using hw:mem_page_size:<size_a>, resize the guest to a flavor
with a different size hw:mem_page_size:<size_b>, and then resize the
guest back to the original flavor. Throughout the tests XML checks are
conducted to ensure the page size is accurate for the present flavor.

Instead of trying to dynamically determine the hugepage sizes configured
on the computes, a new config parameter was added to define what
hugepage sizes are available on the host. To avoid dynamic ram
calculation sizes for the guest based on available hugepages, a guest
ram parameter was also added so users may define the size to use when
spawning guests.

We also need a new job that has multiple hugepage sizes configured. We
cannot use our existing whitebox-devstack-multinode job because that
one runs tests that dynamically turn on file backed memory, which is
incompatible with hugepages. This commit adds tasks into job setup
that allows for the setup of hugepages.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1831269

Change-Id: I5282df3b20c24a909f3b7bb97214206bc07e5b91

'}, {'number': 33, 'created': '2023-12-07 18:59:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin/commit/821310902f4d50be3406ff8fee5fa438758128e7', 'message': 'Test resize with mem_page_size in flavor

These tests are meant to address issue [1]. It adds three new testcases:

 * test_hugepage_resize_keyword_large_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_pagesize_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_size_to_size

All three tests follow the same basic procedure, spawn a guest with a
flavor using hw:mem_page_size:<size_a>, resize the guest to a flavor
with a different size hw:mem_page_size:<size_b>, and then resize the
guest back to the original flavor. Throughout the tests XML checks are
conducted to ensure the page size is accurate for the present flavor.

Instead of trying to dynamically determine the hugepage sizes configured
on the computes, a new config parameter was added to define what
hugepage sizes are available on the host. To avoid dynamic ram
calculation sizes for the guest based on available hugepages, a guest
ram parameter was also added so users may define the size to use when
spawning guests.

We also need a new job that has multiple hugepage sizes configured. We
cannot use our existing whitebox-devstack-multinode job because that
one runs tests that dynamically turn on file backed memory, which is
incompatible with hugepages. This commit adds tasks into job setup
that allows for the setup of hugepages.

In our devstack plugin.sh, we set track_instance_changes to True
(devstack defaults it to False) to make sure the scheduler has the
latest information about available huge pages, and avoid a race
whereing instances failed to schedule because our lone 1G page
still appeared used by an instance that had actually beed fully
deleted.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1831269

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/901196
Change-Id: I5282df3b20c24a909f3b7bb97214206bc07e5b91

Instead of trying to dynamically determine the hugepage sizes configured
on the computes, a new config parameter was added to define what
hugepage sizes are available on the host. To avoid dynamic ram
calculation sizes for the guest based on available hugepages, a guest
ram parameter was also added so users may define the size to use when
spawning guests.

We also need a new job that has multiple hugepage sizes configured. We
cannot use our existing whitebox-devstack-multinode job because that
one runs tests that dynamically turn on file backed memory, which is
incompatible with hugepages. This commit adds tasks into job setup
that allows for the setup of hugepages.

In our devstack plugin.sh, we set track_instance_changes to True
(devstack defaults it to False) to make sure the scheduler has the
latest information about available huge pages, and avoid a race
whereing instances failed to schedule because our lone 1G page
still appeared used by an instance that had actually beed fully
deleted.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1831269

Change-Id: I5282df3b20c24a909f3b7bb97214206bc07e5b91

commit_message:
Test resize with mem_page_size in flavor

These tests are meant to address issue [1]. It adds three new testcases:

 * test_hugepage_resize_keyword_large_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_pagesize_to_small
 * test_hugepage_resize_explicit_size_to_size

All three tests follow the same basic procedure, spawn a guest with a
flavor using hw:mem_page_size:<size_a>, resize the guest to a flavor
with a different size hw:mem_page_size:<size_b>, and then resize the
guest back to the original flavor. Throughout the tests XML checks are
conducted to ensure the page size is accurate for the present flavor.

Instead of trying to dynamically determine the hugepage sizes configured
on the computes, a new config parameter was added to define what
hugepage sizes are available on the host. To avoid dynamic ram
calculation sizes for the guest based on available hugepages, a guest
ram parameter was also added so users may define the size to use when
spawning guests.

We also need a new job that has multiple hugepage sizes configured. We
cannot use our existing whitebox-devstack-multinode job because that
one runs tests that dynamically turn on file backed memory, which is
incompatible with hugepages. This commit adds tasks into job setup
that allows for the setup of hugepages.

In our devstack plugin.sh, we set track_instance_changes to True
(devstack defaults it to False) to make sure the scheduler has the
latest information about available huge pages, and avoid a race
whereing instances failed to schedule because our lone 1G page
still appeared used by an instance that had actually beed fully
deleted.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1831269

Change-Id: I5282df3b20c24a909f3b7bb97214206bc07e5b91

commit_message:
Implement key rotation on the ceph-radosgw charm

This patchset implements key rotation in the ceph-radosgw charm,
by replacing the keyring file if it exists and the ceph-mon
relation reports a new key.

Change-Id: I447b5f827e39118e7dbd430b1c63b3ec4ea3e176
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1195

commit_message:
Allow nebulous-release team to delete branches too

For example, if they were mistakenly created. This pattern follows
other projects with manual branching capabilities.

Additionally, this commit undoes the previous experiment with the
username pattern which, although successful, is not what we need.

Change-Id: If05cef9d0f70d7f1b7b3186acefa9f56e5cb1754

commit_message:
Fix anaconda stage2_id loading from image properties

Anaconda stage2 location is not verified nor loaded when kernel
and ramdisk instance info on a node is already populated, due
to a condition removed by commit 4d653ac225.
This change implements a check based on stage2 label presence
that again allows stage2 to be processed separately from kernel
and ramdisk.

And changes incorrect parameter check_on_exit passed to
oslo_concurrency.processutils.execute() to the correct one,
check_exit_code.

Change-Id: If7bfc99f200fd0bfc9fbe2a4c8d039ba6ae8d0c5
(cherry picked from commit 7a5f80cec758526c6fff62cfdd511fd6d1ae0ea1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/76/883576/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'stage2' in anaconda_labels: 'ksvalidator', ks_file.name, check_exit_code=[0], attempts=1

commit_message:
CI: Unpack cirros image partition jobs

Cirros, by default, as part of its initialization, copies the initial
ramdisk contents over the filesystem on disk. This changes the partition
image creation job so we do it upfront so the partition image looks like
and matches what we generally expect from a partition image as opposed
to just a kernel, ramdisk, and bootloader.

Change-Id: Idde30e33e9453f8564a7c3b9109c4e567146dee7

commit_message:
Update base deployment job

Add openstack-helm-plugin to required projects
and set the helm_plugin_repo pointing to the
openstack-helm-plugin source code directory.

If we try to install the plugin from
https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-plugin.git
it often fails.

Change-Id: I71ab6ad104beb491b5b15b7750e2fc0988db82bf

commit_message:
Add podman gateway driver

Podman is currently the default container tool used in CentOS instead
of Docker. This introduces the gateway implementation to use it.

Change-Id: I0d3c654ae302831b0598f91de1817e50f51753a0

commit_message:
Small Doc Fix: Moved user export for devstack guide.

A small bugfix - you now need to ensure that the user env var is set before running any openstack commands (At least the ones that devstack uses)

Change-Id: I4afad7ea588cf6505a7b1186c749d13827b24290
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/22/916022/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: Source credentials and create a key, and set the user to the admin demo (Note that all the user options can be seen in `/etc/openstack/clouds.yaml`):: export OS_CLOUD=devstack-admin-demo

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2024.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2024.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I85ed3a39421a298e7dc08d88f047e537af0f0b78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/60/913260/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove shell parameter from the call of subprocess_popen

Remove shell parameter from subprocess_popen, [1] removes
shell reference in the above method in Neutron to fulfill
bandit B604 requirement.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/915467

Change-Id: I6866f66e1ee74b28fbe28ec30c11126d00652c2d

commit_message:
Pull puppet openstack modules from unmaintained/xena

Branch name has moved from stable/xena to unmaintained/xena in all
puppet modules as part of switch to unmaintained phase for xena.

Change-Id: I519f34f7083889f4bef9f19cd9a47f4365aa8e5f

commit_message:
Waiting for disconnect volume in a concurrent instance delete

Delete instance with a iSCSI and shared volume can cause multipath
exceptions, which usually occur when a shared volume is attached
to multiple instances of the same node, and then delete one or
multiple at the same time, causing that instance is still connected
to the volume, but the attachment of the volume is already deleted.

When calling destroy of _shutdown_instance, the instance will be
cleaned up to disconnect volume. However, if it is shared, the
connection may not be cleaned up completely. This is because
disconnection will be skipped when calling _should_disconnect_target,
which can cause exceptions during concurrent deletion, a concurrent
deletion does not guarantee that every instance can pass the
_should_disconnect_target check.

The purpose of this patch is to ensure that the attachment is really
deleted after disconnecting as much as possible through retry.

It is worth noting that it may slow down the speed of deleting
the shared volume instance (retry 5 times).

Related-Bug: 2048837

Change-Id: Ib9d826f418fac52d0575a40ca79d0aabebe4a081
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/58/907958/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import retrying # When in a concurrent instance delete, we need to wait for all # requested instances to be removed from the database. Only by # achieving this, can we delete volume attachment during the rest # process of instance delete. But it shouldn't be retried if # disconnect_volume errored directly. @retrying.retry(retry_on_result=lambda x: x, stop_max_attempt_number=5, wait_exponential_multiplier=1000, wait_exponential_max=10000) def _disconnect_volume(): should_retry_disconnect = False if self._should_disconnect_target( context, instance, multiattach, vol_driver, volume_id): vol_driver.disconnect_volume( connection_info, instance, force=force) return should_retry_disconnect else: LOG.info('Detected multiple connections on this host for ' 'volume: %(volume)s, retrying target disconnect.', {'volume': volume_id}) return not should_retry_disconnect _disconnect_volume()
deleted_lines: if self._should_disconnect_target( context, instance, multiattach, vol_driver, volume_id): vol_driver.disconnect_volume( connection_info, instance, force=force) else: LOG.info('Detected multiple connections on this host for ' 'volume: %(volume)s, skipping target disconnect.', {'volume': volume_id})

commit_message:
Replace usage of deprecated [DATABASE] sql_connection

This option was deprecated in oslo.db a long ago and was removed in
master.

Change-Id: Iba6aa00e4f86fc4b82fa354fddf2fc7d6b47c52f

commit_message:
add scaphandre image

Scaphandre is a tool to measure energy consumption of physical and
virtual servers.

Change-Id: I9bfb655252d060a83e73ec850abc9e8edde30f0f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/46/914646/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add scaphandre image. Scaphandre is a tool to mesure energy consumption of physical and virtual servers. More details can be found in the official `documentation <https://hubblo-org.github.io/scaphandre-documentation>`__

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2024.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2024.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0b96ccfe9190f2e470728d92223e3fff0086ecc4

commit_message:
Create new keystone-tempest-plugin release for 2023.1

This proposes a new release of keystone-tempest-plugin. The new
release contains fixes for S-RBAC tests to properly test the
phase 1 and phase 2 RBAC functionality in Keystone.

Change-Id: Ia11e42419c903d34d97d957f82b6a131800085c2

subject: Fix bug #202206, add unit test, remove Zaza bundle
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-03-22 11:14:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-nfs/commit/408b1a5f97af9daaaa018339cf57ee0ba5c33e4b', 'message': "Fix bug #202206 add unit test and add Zaza bundle

create_share_action method raises an exception if the vip config is not set. This config is used for HA integration, which is optional.
Exception is raised due to access to the vips property to determine the public binding. When vip is not set, config.get() returns None and split operation raises AttributeError. Considering the indent here is to return the HA's IP if it is integrated, access_address method has been updated to directly check if HA is integrated or not. commit_message:
Fix bug #202206, add unit test, remove Zaza bundle

create_share_action method raises an exception if the vip config is
not set. This config is used for HA integration, which is optional.
Exception is raised due to access to the vips property to determine
the public binding. When vip is not set, config.get() returns None and
split operation raises AttributeError. Considering the indent here is
to return the HA's IP if it is integrated, access_address method has
been updated to directly check if HA is integrated or not. Also, vips
property updated to use the config_get method of the class. An unit
test has been added for the vips property. Lunar bundle is removed.

Change-Id: Ibd719bcaf66e1d5408e5f682015cff75780df012
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-nfs refs/changes/65/913965/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_vips(self): self.harness.begin() self.assertEqual(self.harness.charm.vips, []) self.harness.update_config({"vip": "1,2,3,4"}) self.assertEqual(self.harness.charm.vips, ["1,2,3,4"])

commit_message:
Remove tobiko job from the periodic queue

This job is broken in the unmaintained/xena and unmaintained/wallaby
branches and it was agred on last Neutron CI meeting to remove it from
the periodic queue in those unmaintained branches.

Change-Id: Iaa4a4b0f4b3a75b85073a89bc37754bcd95208e5

subject: Don't offer to show unmaintained versions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-04-05 12:41:04.000000000', 'files': ['openstackdocstheme/ext.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme/commit/d0a1d47a559076b17a55f793cb33fff0e80349e0', 'message': "Don't offer to show unmaintained versions

Versions older than Zed are now either Unmaintained or EOL. In order to
avoid readers selecting those versions by mistake, bump the default
value for earliest_published_series from mitake to zed. Documentation
for older versions is still published and accessible via direct links.

Projects that want their readers to still access older documentation via
the version selector can do so by overriding the
earliest_published_series value in their docs config.

Change-Id: I5a0cfcdc787f7fcf814526de761ea54479ab30db
"}]
commit_message:
Don't offer to show unmaintained versions

Versions older than Zed are now either Unmaintained or EOL. In order to
avoid readers selecting those versions by mistake, bump the default
value for earliest_published_series from mitake to zed. Documentation
for older versions is still published and accessible via direct links.

Projects that want their readers to still access older documentation via
the version selector can do so by overriding the
earliest_published_series value in their docs config.

Change-Id: I5a0cfcdc787f7fcf814526de761ea54479ab30db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/29/915129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(frickler): Since older versions are now unmaintained, # assume that the earliest version we want to link to is for # zed. Projects that have older docs online can set the option 'earliest_published_series', 'zed')
deleted_lines: # NOTE(dhellmann): Given when this feature was implemented, we # assume that the earliest version we can link to is for # mitaka. Projects that have older docs online can set the option 'earliest_published_series', 'mitaka')

commit_message:
Replace deprecated perl-style regex

Zuul deprecated usage of perl-style regex.

```
  All regular expressions must conform to RE2 syntax, but an
  expression using the deprecated Perl-style syntax has been detected.
  Adjust the configuration to conform to RE2 syntax.
```

Change-Id: Id6b8fbf145b7e933ce2e82cebbe3d6c9531943b6

subject: Fix series selection and sorting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-04-05 12:41:04.000000000', 'files': ['openstackdocstheme/ext.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme/commit/5b20fd8baf87ae5d96b12a47bb4a7e70580bc067', 'message': "Fix series selection and sorting

Currently series names like 2023.1 and later appear at the end of the
version selector, but they are the most recent releases and thus should
be sorted to appear at the beginning.

Also make sure that a series doesn't appear twice in the list, which can
currently happen if e.g. the stable/victoria and unmaintained/victoria
branches exist at the same time during the transition.

Change-Id: Ide82c6de41081b9adcea632e41a581db5bc340c4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix series selection and sorting

Currently series names like 2023.1 and later appear at the end of the
version selector, but they are the most recent releases and thus should
be sorted to appear at the beginning.

Also make sure that a series doesn't appear twice in the list, which can
currently happen if e.g. the stable/victoria and unmaintained/victoria
branches exist at the same time during the transition.

Change-Id: Ide82c6de41081b9adcea632e41a581db5bc340c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/28/915128/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _ref_sort_key(ref): # note(frickler): make sure to sort series like 2023.1 after zed if ref.startswith("2"): return "zzz" + ref return ref all_series = list(set(all_series)) all_series.sort(key=_ref_sort_key)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2024.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2024.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8b22f598106ed44b78454b5350af5beee6fa0b1e

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2024.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2024.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I522c38d329413a91caf6a169f07d2c20dbb1a98e

commit_message:
Update master for stable/2024.1

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/2024.1.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/2024.1.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Icf4966838e05923533cea5463dc25155d7284b7b

commit_message:
Support glance's new location API

This makes us use the new method if available, and if not, fall back
to the old method.

Change-Id: If52ac05a02b69476bd2cfa74a7ee800c3f6eeb20

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2024.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2024.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I694ebd6d7728791b176eae148b9bf67817e27a68

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2024.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2024.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2571357d41958ec5bff2cc77f6335eaa7afaaab7

commit_message:
Update master for stable/2024.1

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/2024.1.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/2024.1.

commit_message:
Deprecate Tripleo independent deliverables

Tripleo deliverables have been deprecated, including those using
independent release model. This should no longer be handled by release
management and therefore be marked release-model: abandoned.

Also reaffect os-apply-config os-collect-config and os-refresh-config to
Heat team to match current governance.

Change-Id: I89c90f174c61ecc45e20b26cf3f82b65adc6a096

commit_message:
Fix erroneous dates in schedule details

Dalmatian release schedule had a few off dates for milestones in the
schedule details section. Also use US English format for dates, as the
project standardizes on US English for communications.

Change-Id: I59876e34091a651ec322635eb90578f457e8bd92

commit_message:
[manila] New Caracal release

This release contains a lot of relevant fixes for making SQLAlchemy
2.0 work in Manila. With the fixes for SQL Alchemy 2.0, Manila is
now compatible and there should not be any issue when using the
newer version of SQLAlchemy.

List of fixes:
$ git log --oneline 18.0.1..eca9ec1955e929e3da0c14cd0ae4da07eb1166c4 --no-merges
eca9ec195 (origin/stable/2024.1) Fixes for sqlalchemy 2.0
1635d03a1 (gerrit/stable/2024.1) Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2024.1
a941b7499 Update .gitreview for stable/2024.1

Signed-off-by: silvacarloss <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0ffc68efd3ef13c15e0064918e6033e4105f932d

commit_message:
Admins can create lease on non reservable hosts

Add is_admin_user value from policy.enforce to create_lease
in lease/service.py so ManagerService can consume it so
lease can be created on hosts marked as non reservable

Change-Id: Ic67ec37535cf0a17ada9b8aeb2e7de8740ed4e2e

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Iddc6f1d90f416b8938a712ac0b04aec807f391a9

added_lines: self, now=None, num_days_before_now=7, num_days_after_now=3, :param num_days_before_now: number of task_container days <= now :param num_days_after_now: number of task_container days > now for i in range(num_days_before_now) for i in range(num_days_after_now) (num_days_before_now + num_days_after_now))) num_expected_iter_calls = num_days_before_now * containers_per_day worst_num_iter_before_delete = ( (num_days_before_now - 1) * containers_per_day min((max_objects_to_cache // non_grace_task_per_container) + 1, containers_per_day) worst_num_iter_before_delete) def _do_test_task_container_iteration(self, stub_shuffle): return num_iter_before_delete, worst_num_iter_before_delete def test_task_container_iteration_order(self): # "in order" is the least optimized "randomization" ordered_num_iter_before_delete, worst_num_iter_before_delete = \ self._do_test_task_container_iteration(lambda x: None) self.assertEqual(ordered_num_iter_before_delete, worst_num_iter_before_delete) # shuffling yields delete tasks sooner shuffled_num_iter_before_delete, worst_num_iter_before_delete = \ self._do_test_task_container_iteration(None) # NB: there is a very small chance that the shuffle leaves the list in # same order and the shuffled result equals the worst case self.assertLess(shuffled_num_iter_before_delete, worst_num_iter_before_delete) reversed_num_iter_before_delete, worst_num_iter_before_delete = \ self._do_test_task_container_iteration(stub_shuffle) # NB: there is a very small chance that the shuffle exactly reversed # the list and the shuffled result equals the best case self.assertLess(reversed_num_iter_before_delete, shuffled_num_iter_before_delete)
deleted_lines: self, now=None, num_days_past_due=7, num_days_after_due=3, :param num_days_past_due: number of task_container days <= now :param num_days_after_due: number of task_container days > now 'AUTH_a3', for i in range(num_days_past_due) for i in range(num_days_after_due) (num_days_past_due + num_days_after_due))) num_expected_iter_calls = num_days_past_due * containers_per_day wrost_num_iter_before_delete = ( (num_days_past_due - 1) * containers_per_day (max_objects_to_cache // non_grace_task_per_container) + 1 wrost_num_iter_before_delete) def test_in_order_task_container_iteration_delays_deletes(self): # "in order" is the least optimized "randomization" stub_shuffle = lambda x: None self.assertEqual(num_iter_before_delete, worst_num_iter_before_delete) def test_randomized_task_container_iteration_hastens_deletes(self): stub_max_objects_to_cache = 10 (now, num_expected_iter_calls, num_expected_delete_calls, worst_num_iter_before_delete) = self._setup_a_bunch_of_tasks( max_objects_to_cache=stub_max_objects_to_cache) # we stub max_objects_to_cache to speed up the test self._expirer_run_once_with_mocks( now=now, stub_shuffle=stub_shuffle, stub_max_objects_to_cache=stub_max_objects_to_cache) iter_object_calls, delete_object_calls, num_iter_before_delete = \ self._sort_out_fake_swift_calls() self.assertEqual(num_expected_iter_calls, len(iter_object_calls)) self.assertEqual(num_expected_delete_calls, len(delete_object_calls)) # since "reverse order" is deterministic, we could update # _setup_a_bunch_of_tasks to calculate the # "best_num_iter_before_delete"; but this assertion works quite well # even with a stub_shuffle = None self.assertLess(num_iter_before_delete, worst_num_iter_before_delete)

commit_message:
Unprovision iso ramdisk boot from test

The boot_iso ramdisk test unfortunately has been discovered to
orphan occupied "nodes" after the test has executed. This change
triggers the test to send a command to force the node to be
unprovisioned at the end of the test.

Closes-Bug: 2055469
Change-Id: Ib525fe099d5884f442cdc375c5a8d230710d20a4

Fixed update_metadef_object

Missed to retrieve the id of the metadef object.
Added the statement to fetch the id of the metadef_object to be
updated

commit_message:
Implement Reverse DNS support for Fixed IPs

This MR implements Reverse DNS for Fixed IPs as detailed in this blueprint: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Designate/Blueprints/ReverseFixedIP

The logic is writting to reflect the Floating IP logic as much as possible, and where possible duplicate logic has been combined together. If there are any questions or remarks, let me know! :-)

We have developed and tested this extensively on our OpenStack environment at Fuga Cloud, where it behaves as expected and we will soon be rolling this out to our customers too.

--------------------------------

Squash Fixed IP PTR

Update parameters.yaml

Update dns-api-v2-reverse-fixedips.inc

Update record.py

Fix formatting

Change-Id: I140f161c960b5d8637cf2d395b8635e8c8d961b1

Fix formatting

Change-Id: I843442fdfbbe92236443cad9c1fd39e9f5c48854

Change Fixed IP key

Change-Id: I2f2655d12424ed61fc8fa445d83119d7b50bc247

Move UUID namespace to constants and function to utils

Change-Id: Iac60d9a22a17bf533cd0f5ee847f499bdc20bd12

Add regex for Fixed IP key

Change-Id: Ib744d00102a782aa0092e85d664e9a832006a246

Remove IP object

Change-Id: I7037723d3c6412557e4f4c4e4a4d4baffeed3ab7

Remove unused functions

Change-Id: I6e36963934acb1f4cdd6326c315b0c432dce1a3c

Fix formatting

Dynamically retrieve external networks

Add fixed_ip unit test

Update test_service.py

Remove IPv6 for fixed IP, requires more substantial work which is out of scope for now

Set IP field to v4/v6 to hopefully support IPv6 too

Change some stuff for UUID

Rework _get_fixed_ips to network api, as designate does not use nova api

Revert "Change _get_fixed_ips strategy"

This reverts commit 4e0a18b3adb8401ff05d4e7e5270af58471aee6d.

Change _get_fixed_ips strategy

Create UUID with dedicated namespace

Add record for listing fixed ips

Add proper UUID for fixed ip

Remove comma causing string to be tuple

Fix unit tests and formatting

First leg of copying FloatingIP tests for FixedIP

Rewrite some conf related options to add FixedIP

Add FixedIP adapters

Replicate various Floating logic for Fixed

Add IP constants for Fixed IP

Add IP objects to init

Reflect central service in rpc API

Rewrite central service for Fixed IP PTR

Add FixedIP object

Add Fixed IP logic to network_api
Change-Id: Iea6f1515e9484a02aa5e9d1bee5005b6c86352b5

Change-Id: I2695fb7460d2e288d65bc6f6c08ecbfa312e5177

added_lines: def test_determine_fixedips(self): self.context = mock.Mock() self.context.project_id = 'tnt' self.service.find_records = mock.Mock(return_value=[ unit.RoObject(managed_extra='') ]) fixed_ips = {} data, invalid = self.service._determine_fixedips( self.context, fixed_ips) self.assertEqual({}, data) self.assertEqual([], invalid) def test_determine_fixedips_with_data(self): self.context = mock.Mock() self.context.project_id = 2 self.service.find_records = mock.Mock(return_value=[ unit.RoObject(managed_extra=1, managed_tenant_id=1), unit.RoObject(managed_extra=2, managed_tenant_id=2), ]) fixed_ips = { 'k': {'address': 1}, 'k2': {'address': 2}, } data, invalid = self.service._determine_fixedips( self.context, fixed_ips) self.assertEqual(1, len(invalid)) self.assertEqual(1, invalid[0].managed_tenant_id) self.assertEqual(data['k'], ({'address': 1}, None))

commit_message:
Replace deprecated perl-style regex

Zuul deprecated usage of perl-style regex.

```
  All regular expressions must conform to RE2 syntax, but an
  expression using the deprecated Perl-style syntax has been detected.
  Adjust the configuration to conform to RE2 syntax.
```

Change-Id: Id9ef016f799ae2bdf27b6c5022b6bec662bec74e

commit_message:
[codespell] Adding CI target for Tox Codespell

Third in a series of commits to add Codespell to Ironic Repos. This commit adds the Tox Target to CI

A future commit could potentially add a git-blame-ignore-revs file if their are lots of spelling mistakes that could clutter git blame.

Change-Id: Icd1bcdea0a129f963510d2ca540e5be2890b88b2

commit_message:
Mark legacy job as non-voting for the time being

The legacy job is broken because of a know issue with tinycore
related to the glibc library.
Moving it to non-voting for the time being while we evaluate if
it's worth trying to fix it or jsut remove it.

Change-Id: I7d433ca3aedf9f0604f9835b65841e7c59283d83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/metalsmith refs/changes/40/916040/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(rpittau): this is broken because of an issue with tinycore # moving to non-voting while we evaluate if it's worth trying to # fix it or just removing it - metalsmith-integration-glance-centos9-legacy: voting: false

commit_message:
Group requirements into sections and sort

We add the script used to do this. This script will grow in complexity
in future changes as we add logic to e.g. remove old version constraints
that are no longer necessary. There's probably more sorting to be done
here, but that can always be tacked on with a follow-up.

Psst, reviewers: you can ensure we haven't lost/gained any dependencies
with this little script:

  #!/usr/bin/env python3
  import pathlib
  import subprocess
  import sys

  previous = subprocess.check_output(
      ['git', 'show', 'HEAD~:global-requirements.txt']
  ).decode(sys.stdout.encoding)
  current = pathlib.Path('global-requirements.txt').read_text()

  assert sorted(
      x for x in previous.split('\n') if x and not x.startswith('#')
  ) == sorted(
      x for x in current.split('\n') if x and not x.startswith('#')
  )

We haven't checked _this_ in since it's trivial and not broadly useful
here.

Change-Id: If836960167fe66534034a8a512ea63553649c3ff
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

subject: Remove stale, unused dependencies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-04-05 16:10:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/4c9b00c0200ae2324aa117f6bc8528b3209ca6c5', 'message': "Remove stale, unused dependencies

- couchdb
  A client library for couchdb that we indicated was only used for
  tests. Trove references it but doesn't list it in requirements and
  instead seems to install from apt

- django-pymemcache
  A django cache backend that allows you to use pymemcache. No users in
  openstack namespace.

- kafka-python
  A client for kafka, replaced by kafka-python3. No users in openstack
  namespace.

- marathon
  No users in openstack namespace.

- oauth2client
  A client library for oauth2. No users in openstack namespace.

- openstack.nose-plugin, nose-exclude, nosehtmloutput, nosexcover, proboscis
  Various plugins for nose. No users in openstack namespace.

- pyinotify
  Python wrappers for the inotify API. Unmaintained since 2015.
  Used by some oslo libs until recently but no longer used.

- python-rsdclient
  Abandoned client library. We no longer depend on this in
  openstackclient.

- sphinx-testing
  A testing package for Sphinx. Replace by the testing module in Sphinx
  itself.

- unittest2
  A backport of unittest features to Python 2.4+. No longer needed.

- zake
  A set of test utilities for kazoo. An optional dependency for tooz but
  not required anywhere.

There are a couple of libraries that we should work to replace, but
those are not tackled here since they need more work elsewhere.

- influxdb
  Deprecated and replaced by influxdb3-python, per the GitHub page
  https://github.com/influxdata/influxdb-python

- jsonpath-rw, jsonpath-rw-ext
  Untouched in 8 and 4 years, respectively, but has a few users dotted
  about.

- nose
  Ancient test runner that's been untouched in 8 years.

- os-client-config
  Unmaintained. Users should switch to openstacksdk.

- oslosphinx
  Unmaintained. Users should switch to openstackdocstheme or another
  theme if not OpenStack-affiliated.

- pydotplus
  A library for interfacing with Graphviz's Dot language. Super old.

- pykmip
  Used by barbican but unmaintained.

- pysendfile
  A test dependency for Glance. Unmaintained since 2014 (!!!).

- pyngus
  A dependency of oslo.messaging. Unmaintained since 2020.

- python-consul
  A dependency of masakari-monitors and an optional dependency of tooz.
  Unmaintained since 2018.

- requests-aws
  An optional dependency of ceilometer. Unmaintained since 2015.

- sadisplay
  An optional dependency of octavia. Unmaintained since 2018.

- testrepository
  A test runner. Unmaintained since 2014 and replaced by stestr.

- testresources, testscenarios
  Add-ons for unittest. Unmaintained since 2016 and 2015, respectively.

Change-Id: I4ea0ca2e4df21446996951617d0d000951069bc6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
